Vault training
Creating a dedicated token to manage our new certificate

To finish off the setup of the vault server we should create a token that has no other access than to use the role we created earler to generate or sign certificates. Then, should we want to automate the task of renewing these certificates we could provide this token. The privleges that a token can be assigned are controlled by policies. The script below shows the process of creating a new policy that only has access to the two endpoints mentioned previously and then generating a new token with these privleges assigned

  • vim vaultrenew.policy
  • Enter the following into the file
  • path "vaultcerts/issue/demo" {   capabilities = ["create", "update"] } path "vaultcerts/sign/demo" {   capabilities = ["create", "update"] }
  • vault policy-write vaultrenew ./vaultrenew.policy
  • Policy 'vaultrenew' written.
  • vault token-create -display-name="vault-renew" -ttl="768h" -orphan -policy="vaultrenew"
  • Key Value --- ----- token <TOKEN> token_accessor 51c06802-751b-70e6-ea89-7ba280fa07f9 token_duration 768h0m0s token_renewable true token_policies [default vaultrenew]
